title: 1970s Progressive Rock
description: From concept albums to epic instrumentals, test your knowledge of the golden age of progressive rock!

questions.question: Which progressive rock band released 'The Dark Side of the Moon' in 1973?
Who was the original lead vocalist of Genesis before Phil Collins took over?
Which band featured Keith Emerson, Greg Lake, and Carl Palmer?
Yes released which epic prog rock album in 1971 featuring 'Roundabout'?
Which King Crimson album, released in 1969, is often considered the first progressive rock album?
options: In the Court of the Crimson King

questions.question: Which Canadian prog rock trio featured Geddy Lee, Alex Lifeson, and Neil Peart?
Jethro Tull was known for featuring which unusual instrument in rock music?
Which Pink Floyd album is a rock opera about a character who builds an emotional wall?
Who designed the iconic album covers for many Yes albums?
Which ELP album featured a rock arrangement of Mussorgsky's 'Pictures at an Exhibition'?
Genesis released which concept album featuring 'The Musical Box' in 1971?
options: The Lamb Lies Down on Broadway

questions.question: Which prog rock band featured Rick Wakeman on keyboards?
What was the name of Jethro Tull's 1972 concept album about a young boy's life?
Which Pink Floyd song features the famous lyric 'We don't need no education'?
Rush's epic 1976 album '2112' was inspired by the writings of which author?
